thread.title: Liberals Will Be Outraged At Bill Maher and You’ll LOVE The Reason Why…
thread.title_full: Liberals Will Be Outraged At Bill Maher and You’ll LOVE The Reason Why…

author: Nickarama
title: Liberals Will Be Outraged At Bill Maher and You’ll LOVE The Reason Why…
text:
Bill Maher is not shy about criticizing some hallmark positions of the left. 
For example, he has no problem saying and criticizing radical Islam. He has been a constant voice from the left that it is a problem that needs to be urgently addressed. 
As Independent Journal Review notes, another area where Maher parts company from those on the left is on free speech. 
On his recent show, he discussed the U.C. Berkeley riots and free speech. 
At ~41:00-43:00: 
Conservative Tomi Lahren stated that there was nothing good about the riots. 
“Nothing that happened at U.C. Berkeley the other night was good. It was militant. It was a riot. It was not a protest.” 
Maher responded, noting that he had invited Milo Yiannopolous to be on the show. 
“They protested someone that I think we’ve booked on our show. So I guess we’ll be putting on extra security… 
Look, I’m not against free speech. Believe me. I’ve been a longtime critic of colleges shutting people up. That is a problem on the left that we need to deal with very much so.” 
Maher then said, “Free speech should be something we [meaning liberals] own.” 
But the problem is that that liberals have become so far left and so “progressive” that they are unable to tolerate any opinion other their own. 
Any other opinion must be shut down or shut up. 
They even chant it in their protests. “If we don’t get it, shut it down” is a common chant. 
What “it” is may often vary, but ultimately it’s about doing what they want, despite facts or whatever concerns anyone else may have. 
If you do not comply, you will not be allowed to operate your business, drive through the intersection they’re blocking or have a speaker they don’t like on a college campus. 
Maher is a little like a voice in the leftist wilderness on this one, but hopefully he can reach some… LIKE this article?
